During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

R Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

WEEKEND 11:45 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Sep 29 - Oct 2 No R trains between Bay Ridge-95 St and 36 St, Brooklyn, due to station enhancements. Take free line closure buses and/or D/N. R service operates days/evenings between 71 Av and 36 St, Brooklyn, and is rerouted via the D to/from 9 Av, the last stop. Late night R service between Brooklyn and Whitehall St is suspended - take the N and/or free line closure buses instead. Free line closure buses make all R stops between Bay Ridge-95 St and 36 St. N trains stop at 45 St and 53 St. Transfer between trains and free line closure buses at 36 St D/N/R or 59 St N. 5 AM to 11 PM, Sat and Sun, Sep 30 - Oct 1 Uptown R trains run express from Canal St to 57 St-7 Av, due to track maintenance. All times until Fall 2017 R trains skip Prospect Av and Bay Ridge Av in both directions, due to station enhancements. For Prospect Av, use the nearby 4 Av-9 St F/G/R (D/N late nights) or 25 St R (D/N late nights) stations via B37 and B63 local buses. For Bay Ridge Av, use the nearby 59 St N/R or 77 St R stations via B9, B37, and B63 local buses.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

An Explanation for This Morning's (Mon., Sept. 25) Delays

The delays up to 20 minutes you experienced during this morning's commute on all three lines were due to the replacement of a track switch in the vicinity of 110th Street on the Park Avenue Viaduct. As part of our ongoing aggressive track maintenance program, Metro-North forces began this work over the weekend which included resurfacing the track and reinstalling the third rail. Unfortunately, due to a mechanical problem with our surfacing equipment, which ensures the smoothness of our track, the work was not completed in time for this morning's rush. We apologize for this inconvenience as a result of this required work.

Planned Work, BKLYN/QNS, Q35 bus, Bridge Maintenance - Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge

Planned work: Q35 buses rerouted from the Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge 10 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Sat, Sep 25 - Oct 25 (Except 10 PM Fri to 5 AM Sat, Sep 29 - 30 & 10 PM Mon to 5 AM Tue, Oct 9 - 10) Due to bridge maintenance, the Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge will be fully closed to traffic. The Q35 will detour non-stop via the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge. Q35 service will be suspended at all Q35 bus stops on Flatbush Av between Troy Av/Quentin Rd and Floyd Bennett Field. B41 buses provide alternate service along Flatbush Av between Avenue H and Kings Plaza/Avenue U. The Q35 will serve the regular bus stops on Avenue H at Flatbush Av, on Flatbush Av at Kings Hwy, and all bus stops in the Rockaways. Note: MTA Bridges and Tunnels will provide free shuttle service from Aviator Sports/Floyd Bennett Field on Flatbush Av to connect to the Q35 from 10 PM to 11:59 PM.

Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will be closed on Sunday, September, 24 from 7:45 a.m. until approximately 3 p.m. for the 16th annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube of the tunnel will be closed from 10 p.m. Saturday, September 23 through 7:45 a.m. on Sunday, September 24. One lane will remain open in each direction in the remaining tube during this time. Additionally, beginning at 7 a.m. on Sunday, no access to the Manhattan-bound HLC from local streets in Brooklyn, access via the Gowanus Expressway only. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route.

Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will be closed on Sunday, September, 24 from 7:45 a.m. until approximately 3 p.m. for the 16th annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube of the tunnel will be closed from 10 p.m. Saturday, September 23 through 7:45 a.m. on Sunday, September 24. One lane will remain open in each direction in the remaining tube during this time. Additionally, beginning at 7 a.m. on Sunday, no access to the Manhattan-bound HLC from local streets in Brooklyn, access via the Gowanus Expressway only. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements. HUGH L. CAREY TUNNEL - MANHATTAN BOUND

Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will be closed on Sunday, September, 24 from 7:45 a.m. until approximately 3 p.m. for the 16th annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube of the tunnel will be closed from 10 p.m. Saturday, September 23 through 7:45 a.m. on Sunday, September 24. One lane will remain open in each direction in the remaining tube during this time. Additionally, beginning at 7 a.m. on Sunday, no access to the Manhattan-bound HLC from local streets in Brooklyn, access via the Gowanus Expressway only. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will be closed on Sunday, September, 24 from 7:45 a.m. until approximately 3 p.m. for the 16th annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube of the tunnel will be closed from 10 p.m. Saturday, September 23 through 7:45 a.m. on Sunday, September 24. One lane will remain open in each direction in the remaining tube during this time. Additionally, beginning at 7 a.m. on Sunday, no access to the Manhattan-bound HLC from local streets in Brooklyn, access via the Gowanus Expressway only. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Harlem Line Customers please be advised northbound trains will not be stopping at Melrose, Tremont, Fordham, Botanical Garden, Williams Bridge and Woodlawn. All northbound trains will carry customers to Wakefield or Mount Vernon West where they will need to transfer to a southbound train back to local stations. This is due to a track condition requiring attention in the vicinity of Botanical Gardens. Please listen for announcements at your station.

Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will be closed on Sunday, September, 24 from 7:45 a.m. until approximately 3 p.m. for the 16th annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube of the tunnel will be closed from 10 p.m. Saturday, September 23 through 7:45 a.m. on Sunday, September 24. One lane will remain open in each direction in the remaining tube during this time. Additionally, beginning at 7 a.m. on Sunday, no access to the Manhattan-bound HLC from local streets in Brooklyn, access via the Gowanus Expressway only. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements. View: http://n.v12.net/m?700C8

Please be advised that until further notice, the North End Access escalator at 47th Street and Madison Avenue will be out of service due to necessary repairs. Customers are advised to use the escalators at 383 Madison Avenue (south corner of 47th Street and Madison Avenue) or the escalator at 48th Street and Park Avenue. We will provide an update when all repairs are complete. Thank you for your patience. View: http://n.v12.net/m?700CF

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Extra Service for start of Rosh Hashanah

On Wednesday, Sept. 20, the LIRR will provide 10 additional early-afternoon trains from Penn Station for customers traveling home early in observance of Rosh Hashanah. Includes four extra trains to Babylon, three extra trains to Hicksville and Huntington, and one each to Far Rockaway, Great Neck & Ronkonkoma. For departure times, see branch timetables or attached link.

Hudson Line, Until Further Notice Bridgeplates Used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms

Until further notice customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. Track 4 will continue to be out of service while work is being performed. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. See our bridgeplate safety instructions here http://ow.ly/HZK230f6yM2 Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. Hudson Line, Until Further Notice Bridgeplates Used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms

Until further notice customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. Track 4 will continue to be out of service while work is being performed. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. See our bridgeplate safety instructions here http://ow.ly/HZK230f6yM2 Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf
Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept. 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

REVISED: Pascack Valley Line Weekday Off-peak/Weekend Busing Sept. 17 - Oct. 28.

Buses will replace weekday off-peak/weekend train service to allow for grade crossing repairs and signal & track maintenance work from Sun., Sept 17 to Sat., Oct. 28. During off-peak weekday hours, trains will operate between Secaucus and Hoboken. On weekdays and weekends while busing is in effect, Metro-North will cross honor monthly and weekly Pascack Valley Line tickets at Tarrytown Station for travel to/from Grand Central. Pascack Valley Line customers may also travel via NJT's Main/Bergen County Lines. See busing details at: http://www.njtransit.com/sa/sa_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=ServiceAdjustmentTo&AdjustmentId=16383 We appreciate your patience during these NJ Transit infrastructure improvements.

Until further notice customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. See our bridgeplate safety instructions here http://ow.ly/HZK230f6yM2 Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. 125th Street Station South Stair Replacement Project, Starts Sept. 11, for approx. 4 months.

Starting today, Sept. 11, the south side stairs at Harlem-125th St. station leading to tracks 2 and 4 (located across from the station building) will undergo repairs which will continue for approximately 4 months. Starting Monday, September 11, work on the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will take place on weekdays from 10 AM, and will continue throughout the day, but with the stairs remaining accessible. Starting Monday, September 18, the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will be closed weeknights between 9 PM and 5 AM, for approximately 2 weeks, while lead abatement work is being performed. Beginning Monday, October 2, the south side stairs leading to platforms 2 and 4 will be inaccessible for approximately 4 months while complete removal and stair replacement is underway. For access to the track 2 and 4 platform during this time, please use elevators or stairs located in the station building. Thank you for your patience during this station improvement project.

125th Street Station South Stair Replacement Project, Starts Sept. 11, for approx. 4 months.

Starting today, Sept. 11, the south side stairs at Harlem-125th St. station leading to tracks 2 and 4 (located across from the station building) will undergo repairs which will continue for approximately 4 months. Starting Monday, September 11, work on the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will take place on weekdays from 10 AM, and will continue throughout the day, but with the stairs remaining accessible. Starting Monday, September 18, the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will be closed weeknights between 9 PM and 5 AM, for approximately 2 weeks, while lead abatement work is being performed. Beginning Monday, October 2, the south side stairs leading to platforms 2 and 4 will be inaccessible for approximately 4 months while complete removal and stair replacement is underway. For access to the track 2 and 4 platform during this time, please use elevators or stairs located in the station building. Thank you for your patience during this station improvement project

Port Jervis Line, Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting tomorrow, September 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.
125th Street Station South Stair Replacement Project, Starts Sept. 11, for approx. 4 months.

Starting tomorrow, Sept. 11, the south side stairs at Harlem-125th St. station leading to tracks 2 and 4 (located across from the station building) will undergo repairs which will continue for approximately 4 months. Starting Monday, September 11, work on the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will take place on weekdays from 10 AM, and will continue throughout the day, but with the stairs remaining accessible. Starting Monday, September 18, the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will be closed weeknights between 9 PM and 5 AM, for approximately 2 weeks, while lead abatement work is being performed. Beginning Monday, October 2, the south side stairs leading to platforms 2 and 4 will be inaccessible for approximately 4 months while complete removal and stair replacement is underway. For access to the track 2 and 4 platform during this time, please use elevators or stairs located in the station building. Thank you for your patience during this station improvement project

125th Street Station South Stair Replacement Project, Starts Sept. 11, for approx. 4 months.

Starting Monday, Sept. 11, the south side stairs at Harlem-125th St. station leading to tracks 2 and 4 (located across from the station building) will undergo repairs which will continue for approximately 4 months. Starting Monday, September 11, work on the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will take place on weekdays from 10 AM, and will continue throughout the day, but with the stairs remaining accessible. Starting Monday, September 18, the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will be closed weeknights between 9 PM and 5 AM, for approximately 2 weeks, while lead abatement work is being performed. Beginning Monday, October 2, the south side stairs leading to platforms 2 and 4 will be inaccessible for approximately 4 months while complete removal and stair replacement is underway. For access to the track 2 and 4 platform during this time, please use elevators or stairs located in the station building. Thank you for your patience during this station improvement project

Starting Monday, Sept. 11, the south side stairs at Harlem-125th St. station leading to tracks 2 and 4 (located across from the station building) will undergo repairs which will continue for approximately 4 months. Starting Monday, September 11, work on the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will take place on weekdays from 10 AM, and will continue throughout the day, but with the stairs remaining accessible. Starting Monday, September 18, the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will be closed weeknights between 9 PM and 5 AM, for approximately 2 weeks, while lead abatement work is being performed. Beginning Monday, October 2, the south side stairs leading to platforms 2 and 4 will be inaccessible for approximately 4 months while complete removal and stair replacement is underway. For access to the track 2 and 4 platform during this time, please use elevators or stairs located in the station building. Thank you for your patience during this station improvement project.

125th Street Station South Stair Replacement Project, Starts Sept. 11, for approx. 4 months.

Starting Monday, Sept. 11, the south side stairs at Harlem-125th St. station leading to tracks 2 and 4 (located across from the station building) will undergo repairs which will continue for approximately 4 months. Starting Monday, September 11, work on the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will take place on weekdays from 10 AM, and will continue throughout the day, but with the stairs remaining accessible. Starting Monday, September 18, the south side stairs leading to tracks 2 and 4 will be closed weeknights between 9 PM and 5 AM, for approximately 2 weeks, while lead abatement work is being performed. Beginning Monday, October 2, the south side stairs leading to platforms 2 and 4 will be inaccessible for approximately 4 months while complete removal and stair replacement is underway. For access to the track 2 and 4 platform during this time, please use elevators or stairs located in the station building. Thank you for your patience during this station improvement project.

Port Jervis Line, Weekday Off-Peak Substitute Busing, Sept. 11 - Through Late Fall

Weekday off-peak substitute busing will be in effect between Port Jervis and Harriman starting Sept. 11, and continuing for several weeks. Inbound (to Hoboken), all trains starting with the 9:26 AM from Port Jervis and ending with the 3:19 PM from Middletown will be bused to Harriman. Outbound (to Port Jervis), all trains starting with the 9:35 AM from Harriman and ending with the 3:48 PM from Harriman will be bused to Port Jervis. Buses will follow the train schedules. Please see http://ow.ly/uSOw30eNabw Thank you for your patience while we complete important rock slope remediation and infrastructure improvements.

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Sept. 1 - 4)

Don't work hard traveling this Labor Day holiday! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long weekend. On Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_dayWOH.htm

Why work hard to get around this Labor Day? Metro-North has extra early getaway service and plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long holiday weekend. On Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_day.htm If you are traveling during the holiday, use MTA eTix, our mobile ticketing app. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Sept. 1 - 4)

Don't work hard traveling this Labor Day holiday! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long weekend. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_dayWOH.htm

Why work hard to get around this Labor Day? Metro-North has extra early getaway service and plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long holiday weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_day.htm If you are traveling during the holiday, use MTA eTix, our mobile ticketing app. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo
West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Sept. 1 - 4)

Don't work hard traveling this Labor Day holiday! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, look for early getaway trains on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_dayWOH.htm

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Sept. 1 - 4)

Don't work hard traveling this Labor Day holiday! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, look for early getaway trains on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_dayWOH.htm

Why work hard to get around this Labor Day? Metro-North has extra early getaway service and plenty of trains to get you to your destination throughout the long holiday weekend. On Friday, Sept. 1, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. On Saturday, Sept. 2 & Sunday, Sept. 3, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 4, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/labor_day.htm If you are traveling during the holiday, use MTA eTix, our mobile ticketing app. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo
